title: Radar Electronic Warfare Response Strategies: Simulation-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of radar principles and basic signal processing knowledge
context.additional_context: Students learn real-time electronic warfare response scenarios using mobile devices and simulation software, with project-based assessments evaluating practical skills

learning_goals: Learners can explain the vulnerabilities of LFM pulse radar and the principles of electronic warfare jamming
Learners can implement jamming detection based on RPIP signals and the PPLFM signal design process in a simulation environment
Learners can analyze jamming signal separation and target identification results using sparse decomposition techniques
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
